title: Request for Bodycam and Arrest Records – March 27, 2025 Arrest of Samuel Davila in Mexia, TX

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Bodycam and Arrest Records – March 27, 2025 Arrest of Samuel Davila in Mexia, TX
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any and all records related to the March 27, 2025 arrest of Samuel Davila in Mexia, Texas. According to public reporting, Mexia Police responded to a location on Willow Street to serve an active warrant for unlawful carrying of a weapon. Davila reportedly attempted to flee on foot before being arrested and transported to Limestone County Jail.

Specifically, I request access to the following records:

Body-worn camera footage from all responding officers

Any dash camera footage if a patrol vehicle was involved

Arrest report(s) and incident narrative(s)

Dispatch call logs or radio communications

Use of force reports or any related supplemental materials

Booking or intake information available from Mexia PD

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Bodycam Footage & Records – Jan. 22, 2025 120 MPH DPS Pursuit of Nicholas Rubio in El Paso

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Bodycam Footage & Records – Jan. 22, 2025 120 MPH DPS Pursuit of Nicholas Rubio in El Paso
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records from a DPS-led pursuit and arrest that occurred on January 22, 2025, involving Nicholas Noel Rubio. The incident began near Rabensteins Drive and McNutt Road in Sunland Park, New Mexico, and proceeded into El Paso, Texas, reaching speeds up to 120 mph. DPS troopers were involved in the pursuit and apprehended Rubio near Santa Fe Street.

The records I seek include:

Body-worn camera footage from any troopers involved in the pursuit or arrest

In-car dash camera video from DPS patrol units

Audio dispatch communications or 911 records

Offense/arrest report(s) and use of force documentation

Any available drone footage or air support video (if applicable)

Booking records or charge summaries filed against Nicholas Noel Rubio

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Bodycam and Related Records – High-Speed Chase Ending at Alamo Quarry on Nov. 14, 2024

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Bodycam and Related Records – High-Speed Chase Ending at Alamo Quarry on Nov. 14, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any and all body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, police reports, dispatch audio, and supplemental documentation associated with the high-speed chase involving Marie Schneider that occurred on November 14, 2024. The incident began in Comal County and ended at the Alamo Quarry in San Antonio, Bexar County.

The Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) was involved in the pursuit. The subject, Marie Schneider (37), allegedly struck several vehicles and assaulted a State Trooper during the incident. She was arrested on-site and faces multiple charges including assault on a peace officer and driving while intoxicated.

If your agency possesses records from any involved Troopers, please include:

Body-worn camera footage from troopers at the scene

In-car dash camera video of the pursuit and/or arrest

911 call or dispatch audio referencing the pursuit or arrest

Arrest report, incident report, use of force report, or offense narrative

Any booking photos and charge summaries filed at the time of arrest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Body Camera Footage and Incident Records – Feb 2, 2025 I-35 Chase (Bell County & Troy PD) (Troy Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the high-speed pursuit and arrests that occurred on February 2, 2025, beginning around 12:30 a.m. on Interstate 35 near the 310-mile marker in Troy, Texas. The incident involved two four-door vehicles reportedly traveling at 108 MPH. The first vehicle attempted to exit and re-enter the highway multiple times, then tried to drive northbound in the southbound lanes near Industrial Boulevard in Temple. Troy Police reportedly forced the vehicle off the road, and three suspects were arrested after a foot pursuit. Weapons and drugs were reportedly recovered.

Please include:

Body camera footage from Troy PD, Bell County SO, Temple PD, and Lorena PD

Dashcam video from all police units involved in the pursuit and apprehension

911 call audio and radio dispatch logs from the incident

Incident and arrest reports, including affidavits, if available

Any photos, drone, or scene video footage

Any use of force documentation (if applicable)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Camera and Incident Records – Tyler Ellis High-Speed Chase (March 18, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all public records related to the high-speed vehicle pursuit and arrest of 17-year-old Tyler Ellis on March 18, 2025, by the Port Aransas Police Department and assisting agencies including the Nueces County Sheriff’s Office and DPS units.

The incident occurred around 6:16 p.m. beginning near Mile Marker 35 on Highway 361 and ended after a crash near Access Road 2. Reports state that multiple passengers exited the vehicle and ran, and one continued driving before crashing.

Specifically, I am requesting:

Body camera footage from all involved officers

Dashcam footage from PAPD and DPS units

911 call audio and dispatch logs related to the pursuit

Incident and arrest reports including affidavits

Any inter-agency communication or coordination records between PAPD, DPS, and Nueces County SO

communications.communication:

Specifically, I am requesting:

Body-worn camera footage of any responding officers during the arrests or investigation

title: Request for Records – March 23, 2025 Incident Involving Juvenile Aggravated Assault – Harris County, TX

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Records – March 23, 2025 Incident Involving Juvenile Aggravated Assault – Harris County, TX
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to a juvenile aggravated assault incident that occurred in Houston, Texas, on or about Sunday, March 23, 2025, involving three teenage sisters ages 14, 15, and 16. The case was reported by ABC13 and the Harris County Sheriff's Office.

According to reports, the teens allegedly attacked their mother inside their home after she turned off the Wi-Fi. One of the teens struck the mother with a brick, and their grandmother was reportedly knocked down while trying to protect the victim.

All three teens were arrested and booked into the Harris County Juvenile Facility, charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.

I am requesting:

Initial offense and arrest reports

Incident call logs and dispatch audio

Any available body-worn camera or dashcam footage

Booking information for the juveniles (if releasable under Texas law)

Any supplemental reports or affidavits filed in relation to the incident

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Request for Records – Arrest of Michael Anthony Montoya Jr. on March 17, 2025 – Texas DPS

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Records – Arrest of Michael Anthony Montoya Jr. on March 17, 2025 – Texas DPS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to the arrest of Michael Anthony Montoya Jr., a 35-year-old male from San Juan, Texas, who was arrested by the Texas Department of Public Safety on or about March 17, 2025, in Cameron County, Texas.

According to media reports, DPS attempted to stop a black 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokee on SH 4 in Brownsville. The driver allegedly refused to stop, leading to a chase and crash at an intersection. Troopers then reportedly located eight plastic-wrapped bundles of marijuana in the vehicle's cargo area. The bundles weighed an estimated 200 pounds.

Montoya was charged with evading arrest and felony possession of marijuana. He was booked into the Cameron County Jail.

I am requesting the following records:

Arrest and offense reports

Dashcam and/or body-worn camera footage from DPS troopers involved

911 call audio or dispatch communications

Booking and intake records

Any supplemental or investigative reports related to the arrest

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to public reports, Mr. Grant failed to yield to a deputy during a traffic stop for speeding and an equipment violation. He was eventually arrested after striking a school zone sign. He was booked into the McCracken County Regional Jail on several charges including:

Fleeing or Evading Police (2nd Degree – Motor Vehicle)

Careless Driving

Criminal Mischief (1st Degree)

Possession of Marijuana and Drug Paraphernalia

No Insurance

title: Request for Records Related to Fatal Arlington DWI Pedestrian Crash – Julian Flores

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Records Related to Fatal Arlington DWI Pedestrian Crash – Julian Flores
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to the arrest and fatal crash involving Julian Flores, a 31-year-old male who was taken into custody by law enforcement in Dallas County, Texas, in connection with a deadly DWI crash. The incident occurred in the early hours of Sunday, March 24, 2025, when Flores, reportedly driving at speeds up to 100 mph, struck and killed a pedestrian on Interstate 30 in Grand Prairie. Flores has a prior DWI conviction and was booked into the Dallas County Jail.

Please provide the following records, if available:

Body-worn camera footage from all responding officers

Dashcam footage from patrol units on scene

Arrest report, probable cause affidavit, and any citations issued

911 call recordings and dispatcher logs related to the incident

Any supplemental reports, witness statements, or DWI testing documentation

This request is submitted under the Texas Public Information Act (TPIA). I respectfully request that records be provided via email in digital format if possible. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the legal justification for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Records Request – March 23, 2025 Fatal DWI Crash on I-20 (Cesar Ramirez Castro & Co.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the March 23, 2025, fatal DWI crash that occurred on eastbound I-20 near Bowen Road in Arlington, Texas, in which a 22-year-old man was killed. The Arlington Police Department responded to the crash around 7:35 p.m., which involved a pickup truck and a passenger car. The crash resulted in a fire that fully engulfed the car and led to the death of the driver.

Three individuals were arrested in connection with this crash:

Cesar Ramirez Castro (driver of the pickup, charged with intoxication manslaughter and collision involving death)

Marcelino Ramirez-Ramirez

Castro Zammarron

I am requesting the following:

Body-worn camera footage from all officers on scene

Dashcam footage (including any unit on-scene or en route)

911 call audio and dispatch records

Arrest reports, incident reports, and affidavits

Any mugshots and booking documentation

Supplemental reports and diagrams related to crash scene investigation

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: D011725-032725
communications.communication:
Dear Christopher  Udeani: Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of Dallas. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 3/27/2025 and given the reference number: D011725-032725 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting public records related to the arrest of Francisco Sanchez-Alfaro, an 18-year-old male who was arrested by the Dallas Police Department after crashing into a Dallas police sergeant’s vehicle while driving under the influence. The incident occurred on or around March 25, 2025, just before 3 a.m. at or near Cedar Springs Road and Manor Way, near Dallas Love Field Airport.

The subject, Francisco Sanchez-Alfaro, was reportedly intoxicated and driving a Chevy Camaro when he ran a red light and collided with a Dallas police vehicle during a routine patrol. The officer's car was forced off-road, and the Camaro hit a utility pole. Sanchez-Alfaro was arrested and booked into the Dallas County Jail without bond and placed on an immigration hold.

Please include the following records:

Body-worn camera footage from all officers involved in the incident

Dashcam footage from the patrol vehicle(s)

911 call recordings and dispatch (CAD) logs

Arrest report, incident report, and DWI affidavit

Mugshot (if publicly releasable)

Any internal review or supplemental records related to the use of force or crash

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request Re: Bruce Gordon Emerman

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request Re: Bruce Gordon Emerman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records in any format relating to the death of Bruce Gordon Emerman, as noted in Lynchburg Police incident 2023-019762. This request includes, but is not limited to, the following records: 

All police reports, incident reports, and supplemental reports related to incident 2023-019762. 
Any and all communications, including emails, memos, or correspondence, between Lynchburg Police Department personnel or other city officials regarding Bruce Gordon Emerman or incident 2023-019762. 
Any and all audio or video recordings, including body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, or surveillance footage, related to incident 2023-019762. 
Any and all photographs taken during the investigation of incident 2023-019762. 
Any and all forensic reports, autopsy reports, toxicology reports or medical examiner records related to Bruce Gordon Emerman. 
Any and all records related to the disposition of Bruce Gordon Emerman's body, including communications, court filings, or orders. 
Any and all records related to the Lynchburg Circuit Court case CL24000036-00, including filings, orders, and communications. 
Any and all records related to the handling of incident 2023-019762 or the disposition of Bruce Gordon Emerman's body. 
Any and all records related to the involvement of external agencies, if any, in the investigation or handling of incident 2023-019762. 
Any and all records, inventories, or documentation of personal items belonging to Bruce Gordon Emerman, including but not limited to files, notebooks, papers, electronic devices, or other personal effects, whether collected, retained, or disposed of during or after the investigation. 
I request that these records be provided in any available format, including electronic formats such as PDFs, Excel files, or other digital formats. Please include an estimate of any costs associated with fulfilling this request. If there are any questions or clarifications needed regarding this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at the provided contact information below. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Steven Slowik.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

F.Ferrari
March 27, 2025

Laredo police department
Record management
Subject: Request for records related to A traffic violation and incident to arrest

To whom has relevance within the Laredo Police Department Records Division,

Under the Texas Public Information Act, Tex. Gov’t Code §552.001 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to obtain copies of public records that Relate to a traffic stop by a Laredo police department deputy, Which became an incident to arrest. I am requesting for any and all information related to a vehicle stop on September 9,2024, at the intersection of Jefferson St and San Bernardo Ave in Laredo, TX.
The information, Reports and or documentation being sought are as follows:
THE BASIC INFORMATION OF SURROUNDING THE TRAFFIC STOP AND ARREST OF MR. RAUL BOTELLO JR. 
this includes any and all basic
information appearing in other records of law enforcement agencies, such as blotters, arrest sheets, and "show-up sheets," as they are not excepted from disclosure by section 552.108.522


 The kinds of basic information not excepted from disclosure by section $52.108 are those that were deemed public in Houston Chronicle Publ'g Co. v. City of ou and candied appen Port agon No. 127 197o, 4 Basic information is

(b) the date and time of the arrest;
(c) the place of the arrest;
(d) the offense charged and the court in which it is filed;
(e) the details of the arrest; (f)
booking information;
(g) the notation of any release or transfer;
(h) bonding information;
(i) the location of the crime;
(i) the identification and description of the complainant;
(k) the premises involved;
(I) the time of occurrence of the crime;
(m) the property involved, if any;
(n) the vehicles involved, if any;
(o) a description of the weather;
detailed description of the offense; and
(9)
the names of the arresting and investigating officers.

I am also requesting any and all of the following in relation to this incident from the start of the traffic stop, throughout and ending at the arrest of Mr Raul Bottelo Jr. DOB 3/07/2022

 1.body cam footage,
2 dash cam footage, 
3police reports, 
4.red light recordings

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $ 50.00  However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the people of Texas and the understanding of  the transparency and compliance of Law Enforcement within the State of Texas.  This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

 

The Texas Public Information Act requires that you “promptly produce” the requested records unless, within 10 days, you have sought an Attorney General’s Opinion.  If you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. I am aware that the camera footage allows for an extended period, however I am asking that the other records still be released within the permitted time and to be informed on the expectancy dates for the digital requests. 

 

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you for considering my request.
I look forward to hearing from you soon,

Sincerely,

F. Ferrari-Roberts

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Allison

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W040262-032725
communications.communication:
Welcome to the City of Laredo Open Records Center. We have received your Public Information Request, and it has been diverted to the appropriate department for processing. Pursuant to the Public Information Act, the governmental body will try to complete the request within a reasonable amount of time depending on the nature of the request. However, you can expect to receive notification should the request require more than 10 business days to complete. 

Please note, the Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. In addition, the City of Laredo may collect a fee as prescribed by law or regulation for the requested documents. If a fee is not prescribed by law or regulation, the fee shall be the actual cost of duplicating the record(s) and any applicable labor costs. 

Finally, you can monitor the progress of your request through the automated open records center on the City of Laredo website .  Unfortunately, this email is an automated notification, which is unable to receive replies. Therefore, if you have any questions with respect to a pending request or pertaining to any open records issue,  you may directly contact this office through the open records center.  You may also reach us by phone at the number below. 

Very truly yours, 

City Attorney's Office 
Public Information Coordinator for the City of Laredo 
1110 Houston Street 
City Hall, 3rd Floor 
Laredo, Texas 78040 
(956) 791-7319 Telephone 
(956) 791-7494 Facsimile

title: Communications: Dept. of Justice, Education

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Communications: Dept. of Justice, Education
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm reaching out because this school was recently included on a list of 60 schools that received letters from the Dept. of Education saying they were under investigation for "Antisemitic Discrimination and Harassment."
Source: https://www.ed.gov/about/news/press-release/us-department-of-educations-office-civil-rights-sends-letters-60-universities-under-investigation-antisemitic-discrimination-and-harassment
Also, recently, two students and counting from Columbia University (which is on this list) have been arrested by immigration authorities.
Source: https://apnews.com/article/columbia-university-mahmoud-khalil-ice-arrests-3a8db6e646b786a721089a6f0bc8d9fc

Therefore, pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records (from January 20, 2025 to the time that this request is processed):
1) Any emails between A) either, members of your institution's police department/safety office, OR the office of the president, OR the department of student housing/on-campus living, and B) any individuals with the email domain "@ed.gov" OR "@justice.gov" 

I am a reporter for WIRED filing this request in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story; therefore, I ask that my request is expedited.  Also, as a reporter for WIRED, the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. 

When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released.  Also, I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method. Also, if you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so, whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

If there are any questions about my request, or I can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me here. I am also happy to hop on the phone. Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 10 business days, as the statute requires, and even sooner if possible.

Best,
Caroline Haskins

title: George W. Bush Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related to Lia, Georgia Radiological Accident

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: George W. Bush Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related to Lia, Georgia Radiological Accident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, audio or visual recordings, or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the Lia radiological accident and the accident's aftermath. The Lia radiological incident occurred in the country of Georgia in late 2001 and early 2002. The accident was the result of improperly stored and abandoned Soviet-era radioisotope thermoelectric generators. This accident resulted in the injuries to three Georgian villagers. The accident happened just months after 9/11 and the government of Georgia openly asked for international assistance from the International Atomic Energy Agency (the IAEA) in locating the material. 

This incident is likely to have generated considerable national security correspondence. Georgia's government was an ally of the United States. The United States is a member of the IAEA, and the Georgian government requesed help from the IAEA. Issues related to errant nuclear materials in the former Soviet Union were a prerogative of the United States as part of the Cooperative Threat Reduction program created by the Nunn-Lugar act. In the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks, threats related to "dirty bomb" attacks were routinely reported on in nightly newscasts and in the newspapers. 

More information about the Lia incident can be found in this report published by the IAEA:

https://www-pub.iaea.org/MTCD/Publications/PDF/Pub1660web-81061875.pdf

Please conduct a search for information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, audio or visual recordings, or similar records related to the Lia, Georgia incident. Limit the search to documents related to the Lia incident created from December 2nd 2001 to December 2nd 2005. An additional interest would be if the Lia incident and the aftermath was discussed in relation to the beginning of the Saakashvili administration some years later. 

Thank you for your commitment to transparency and I look forward to working together until this request is resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: State Department: "Catch and Revoke" search terms

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any search terms or queries used for searching social media or news reports as a result of the "Catch and Revoke" effort reported by Axios on March 6, 2025 (https://www.axios.com/2025/03/06/state-department-ai-revoke-foreign-student-visas-hamas) and on March 27, 2025 (https://www.axios.com/2025/03/27/trump-palestinian-hamas-purge-colleges-protests).

2. Any policies, manuals, or training materials concerning the intent or use of the "Catch and Revoke" effort.

3. Any contract or agreement with any entity concerning any services, software, or platforms used for the purpose of the "Catch and Revoke" effort.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 22 CFR § 171.12(d)(1)(ii) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and free expression, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department's involvement in the revocation of visas or green cards due to protest activity or expression protected by the First Amendment.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a breaking news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic.

Examples of recent articles and statements demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include:

a. https://www.axios.com/2025/03/06/state-department-ai-revoke-foreign-student-visas-hamas
b. https://www.axios.com/2025/03/27/trump-palestinian-hamas-purge-colleges-protests
c. https://www.justsecurity.org/109069/u-s-ai-driven-catch-and-revoke-initiative-threatens-first-amendment-rights/
d. https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/policy/immigration/3346812/trump-administration-ai-revoke-visas-pro-hamas-students/
e. https://www.ibtimes.com/us-uses-ai-ban-student-visas-over-hamas-supportheres-what-you-need-know-3766019
f. https://www.wkrn.com/news/national/state-department-using-ai-to-ban-visas-over-perceived-pro-hamas-posts/amp/
g. https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-14471541/marco-rubio-canceling-visas-foreigners-hamas-support.html
h. https://m.economictimes.com/nri/latest-updates/trump-administration-to-use-ai-in-an-effort-to-catch-and-revoke-student-visas-over-alleged-hamas-support/articleshow/118778056.cms
i. https://gizmodo.com/state-department-will-use-ai-to-search-for-pro-hamas-students-to-deport-2000573143
j. https://www.nysun.com/article/state-department-begins-canceling-visas-of-pro-terror-students-plans-to-use-ai-to-identify-visa-holding-hamas-sympathizers
k. https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/us-deploys-ai-to-revoke-visas-of-foreign-nationals-supporting-hamas-report-19570130.htm
l. https://www.jta.org/2025/03/07/united-states/trump-administration-reportedly-to-use-ai-to-find-hamas-supporting-foreign-students-to-deport
m. https://townhall.com/tipsheet/rebeccadowns/2025/03/06/its-happening-state-department-revoking-visas-of-pro-hamas-agitators-here-on-student-visas-n2653416
n. https://nypost.com/2025/03/06/us-news/state-department-to-deploy-ai-powered-catch-and-revoke-tools-against-hamas-sympathizers-report/
o. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/mar/06/foreign-student-visas-pro-palestinian-ai
p. https://www.reuters.com/technology/artificial-intelligence/us-use-ai-revoke-visas-students-perceived-hamas-supporters-axios-reports-2025-03-06/
q. https://www.foxnews.com/politics/state-department-revokes-first-visa-foreign-student-linked-hamas-supporting-disruptions
r. https://townhall.com/tipsheet/guybenson/2025/03/10/yes-of-course-we-should-revoke-student-visas-from-hamas-supporters-n2653506
s. https://radio.foxnews.com/2025/03/10/state-department-to-use-ai-to-send-foreign-pro-hamas-students-packing/
t. https://www.dailywire.com/news/trumps-ice-detains-anti-israel-activist-who-led-campus-protests-at-columbia
u. https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2025-03-07/ty-article/u-s-to-reportedly-use-ai-to-revoke-visas-of-students-it-sees-as-hamas-supporters/00000195-6e84-d0f8-a1f7-7ec70da10000
v. https://www.vanityfair.com/news/story/donald-trumps-student-visa-crackdown-free-speech


REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 22 CFR § 171.16(j), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by United States officials in response to campus protests.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Rumeysa Ozturk visa or green card revocation (Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records concerning the revocation of a visa or green card with respect to Rumeysa Ozturk who was arrested on or about March 25, 2025.

2. Any communications with the White House concerning Rumeysa Ozturk.

3. Any communications with the Department of Homeland Security concerning Rumeysa Ozturk on or after January 20, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 22 CFR § 171.12(d)(1)(ii) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and free expression, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department's involvement in the revocation of a visa or green card due to protest activity or expression protected by the First Amendment.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic.

Examples of recent articles and statements demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include:

a. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/26/us/ice-tufts-student-detained-rumeysa-ozturk.html
b. https://www.wsj.com/us-news/law/tufts-graduate-student-detained-by-federal-immigration-authorities-42d57a0a
c. https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-14540283/turkish-student-hijab-filmed-detained-ice-ramadan-tufts-university.html
d. https://www.smh.com.au/world/north-america/looked-like-a-kidnapping-uni-student-taken-by-masked-agents-in-trump-crackdown-20250327-p5lmy9.html
e. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/mar/26/ice-agents-detain-tufts-university-graduate-student
f. https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/tufts-student-detained-masked-federal-agents-1235304299/
g. https://www.bostonglobe.com/2025/03/26/metro/its-really-scary-students-residents-react-sudden-arrest-tufts-student/
h. https://www.axios.com/local/boston/2025/03/26/tufts-rumeysa-ozturk-detained
i. https://www.cnn.com/2025/03/26/us/video/tufts-student-detained-rumeysa-ozturk-ice-digvid
j. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2025/03/26/federal-agents-detain-tufts-university-student-turkey/82674919007/
k. https://www.boston25news.com/news/local/international-student-tufts-university-reportedly-taken-into-federal-custody/2VK55QMAOZFIDBR2A6XNKC5XOU/
l. https://www.boston.com/news/politics/2025/03/26/ag-campbell-says-shes-monitoring-situation-after-tufts-grad-student-arrested-by-ice/
m. https://www.bostonglobe.com/2025/03/26/metro/tufts-student-detailed-by-immigration-officials/
n. https://www.nytimes.com/video/us/100000010075008/tufts-student-ice-arrest.html?playlistId=video/latest-video
o. https://www.jns.org/common-sense-arrest-of-pro-hamas-protester-rumeysa-ozturk-says-homeland-security/
p. https://www.bostonherald.com/2025/03/26/tufts-graduate-student-whos-pro-palestinian-detained-by-federal-authorities-in-somerville/
q. https://www.rawstory.com/watch-stunning-video-shows-turkish-tufts-grad-student-cuffed-by-homeland-security/
r. https://forward.com/fast-forward/707596/tufts-international-grad-student-detained-by-ice-in-latest-action-targeting-pro-palestinian-activist/
s. https://www.mediaite.com/news/disturbing-video-shows-masked-men-hauling-away-pro-palestine-student-her-whereabouts-are-unknown/
t. https://www.huffpost.com/entry/rumeysa-ozturk-canary-mission-tuft-university_n_67e44604e4b00db00a39340e
u. https://www.foxnews.com/video/6370602253112
v. https://www.reuters.com/world/us/tufts-says-international-student-taken-into-us-custody-visa-revoked-2025-03-26/
w. https://nypost.com/2025/03/26/us-news/tufts-says-international-student-taken-into-us-custody-visa-revoked/
x. https://pressley.house.gov/2025/03/26/rep-pressleys-statement-on-arrest-of-tufts-student-rumeysa-ozturk/
y. https://www.nbcnews.com/now/video/video-shows-arrest-of-tufts-university-graduate-student-235439685766
z. https://www.cair.com/press_releases/cair-ma-condemns-ice-abduction-of-tufts-student-rumeysa-ozturk/
aa. https://www.seattletimes.com/news/turkish-student-at-tufts-university-detained-video-shows-masked-people-handcuffing-her/
bb. https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2025-03-26/turkish-student-at-tufts-university-detained-video-shows-masked-people-handcuffing-her


REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 22 CFR § 171.16(j), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by United States officials in response to campus protests.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Putnam County Opioid Settlement Fund Request

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Putnam County Opioid Settlement Fund Request
communications.communication:
Johnathan Edwards 
2040 University Avenue- Apartment 301
Morgantown, WV 26505

02/24/2025

Brian Wood
Putnam County Clerk
Clerk’s Office of Putnam County
12093 Winfield Road #3
Winfield, WV 25213

Dear Mr. Wood: 

Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that show the following; Allocation of opioid settlement funds received by Putnam County, the application that individuals or organizations seeking funding from the county complete, copies of grant applications from individuals or organizations that have been approved to receive these funds, the individuals who will review the funding applications, any meeting minutes of county-level officials where the receiving or distribution of county-level opioid settlement funding was discussed, and how much funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how this large sum of allocated funds is being distributed across the county. I am a student reporter at West Virginia University and intend to use this information to more accurately report on these findings. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. You can call me at 304-638-6367 or send me an email at jde00006@mix.wvu.edu My physical address is 2040 University Ave. Morgantown, WV, 26505.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott
